snippet: Friction between the rich and poor is the greatest source of tension in American society, according to a new survey.
abstract: Survey conducted by the Pew Research Center finds two-thirds of Americans now believe there are 'strong conflicts' between the rich and poor; issue was cited ahead of racial strain and friction between immigrants and the native-born, making it the greatest source of tension in American society.
lead_paragraph: Friction between the rich and poor is the greatest source of tension in American society, according to a new survey.

headline.seo: More Conflict Seen Between Rich and Poor, Survey Finds
headline.main: Survey Finds Rising Perception of Class Tension
headline.print_headline: Survey Finds Rising Strain Between Rich And the Poor
